intro: Ixiosporum spinescens, commonly known as the spiny spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and leaves. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Its latex is milky and can be toxic, a common trait among members of the spurge family. Ixiosporum spinescens is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in disturbed habitats.
